xss-quiz.title: XSS Quiz
xss-quiz.description: Test your knowledge of Cross-Site Scripting vulnerabilities

questions.question: What does XSS stand for?
questions.explanation: XSS stands for Cross-Site Scripting, a vulnerability that allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into web pages.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of XSS?
questions.explanation: Server-side XSS is not a valid type. The three main types are Reflected, Stored, and DOM-based XSS.

questions.question: What is the primary defense against XSS attacks?
questions.explanation: Output encoding is the primary defense, ensuring that user input is properly escaped when displayed.

questions.question: Which HTML attribute is commonly exploited in XSS attacks?
questions.explanation: All of these attributes can be exploited if user input is not properly sanitized.

questions.question: What does CSP stand for in XSS prevention?
questions.explanation: Content Security Policy (CSP) is a security standard that helps prevent XSS attacks.

sqli-quiz.title: SQL Injection Quiz
sqli-quiz.description: Test your knowledge of SQL injection vulnerabilities and prevention

questions.question: What is SQL injection?
options: A vulnerability that allows SQL code injection
questions.explanation: SQL injection is a vulnerability that allows attackers to inject malicious SQL code into database queries.

questions.question: Which of the following is the most effective way to prevent SQL injection?
questions.explanation: Prepared statements (parameterized queries) are the most effective defense against SQL injection.

questions.question: What does UNION-based SQL injection do?
questions.explanation: UNION-based SQL injection combines the results of multiple SELECT statements.

questions.question: Which character is commonly used to comment out SQL code?
questions.explanation: All of these can be used for commenting in SQL, though -- is most common in SQL injection attacks.

questions.question: What is blind SQL injection?
questions.explanation: Blind SQL injection occurs when the application doesn't return the results of the SQL query.

forensics-quiz.title: Digital Forensics Quiz
forensics-quiz.description: Test your knowledge of digital forensics and incident response

questions.question: What is the first step in digital forensics?
questions.explanation: Preservation is the first step - ensuring evidence is not altered or destroyed.

questions.question: What does MD5 stand for in forensics?
questions.explanation: MD5 (Message Digest 5) is a cryptographic hash function used to verify file integrity.

questions.question: Which tool is commonly used for memory forensics?
questions.explanation: Volatility is a popular open-source tool for memory forensics and analysis.

questions.question: What is a write blocker used for?
questions.explanation: A write blocker prevents any modifications to the original evidence during analysis.

questions.question: What does RAM stand for in computer forensics?
questions.explanation: RAM (Random Access Memory) is volatile memory that can contain valuable forensic evidence.

network-quiz.title: Network Security Quiz
network-quiz.description: Test your knowledge of network security and protocols

questions.question: What port does HTTPS typically use?
questions.explanation: HTTPS typically uses port 443, while HTTP uses port 80.

questions.question: What is a man-in-the-middle attack?
options: An attack where the attacker intercepts communication
questions.explanation: A man-in-the-middle attack occurs when an attacker intercepts and potentially modifies communication between two parties.

questions.question: Which protocol is connectionless?
questions.explanation: UDP (User Datagram Protocol) is connectionless, while TCP is connection-oriented.

questions.question: What does VPN stand for?
questions.explanation: VPN stands for Virtual Private Network, providing secure communication over public networks.

questions.question: Which tool is used for network packet analysis?
questions.explanation: Wireshark is a popular network protocol analyzer for capturing and analyzing network traffic.

webapp-quiz.title: Web Application Security Quiz
webapp-quiz.description: Test your knowledge of web application vulnerabilities and security

questions.question: What is CSRF?
questions.explanation: CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) forces users to perform actions they didn't intend to.

questions.question: What is the OWASP Top 10?
options: A list of most critical web application security risks
questions.explanation: The OWASP Top 10 is a list of the most critical web application security risks.

questions.question: What is session hijacking?
options: Taking control of a user's session
questions.explanation: Session hijacking involves taking control of a user's session to impersonate them.

questions.question: What is input validation?
questions.explanation: Input validation checks if user input meets expected criteria and is safe to process.

questions.question: What is a security header?
options: An HTTP response header that enhances security
questions.explanation: Security headers are HTTP response headers that enhance the security of web applications.
